results.title: Goldilocks and the three bears. The Little mermaid
results.creator_credit: Home Box Office, Libby Simon and Edward Bell
results.brief_description: Two animated and humorous adaptations of fairy tales for children. “Goldilocks and the three bears”: Goldilocks is a girl from a tropical village, an impish scallywag with an uncompromising attitude, unfazed even when getting others into strife. But when she wanders into a forest she meets a spider, snake and bat, who try to warn her off the three bears that could land her in serious trouble. This amusing and funky short underpins the values of friendship and selflessness. “The Little mermaid”: Beneath the hustle and bustle of Taipei international trading port, a secret underwater kingdom exists where a mermaid, Princess Mija and her best friend, a starfish named Nuri, live happily under the watchful eye of Queen Hul-muh-ni. At fifteen years of age, Mija’s life changes forever when she falls for a human prince and has to choose between love and life in the ocean with her family. Features the voices of Tia Carrere, Margaret Cho, Raven Symone, Alfre Woodard, Jennifer Lewis and Lou Rawls.

results.title: Goldilocks and the three bears
results.creator_credit: Weston Woods Studios, Zdenka Deitchova and Milan Klikar
results.brief_description: The traditional story of “Goldilocks and the three bears” is told in this short animated children’s film. When the Three Bears go out, mischievous Goldilocks enters their house and wrecks havoc. Based on the book by James Marshall.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Weston Woods Studios, Zdenka Deitchova and Milan Klikar

results.title: Goldilocks and the three bears
results.brief_description: The story of Goldilocks and the three bears, remaining faithful to the incidents and characterizations of the original tale. Suggestions for drawing pictures of the scenes of the story and for exploring other favourite stories provide children with an incentive for reading and artwork activities.

results.title: GoldenEye 007
results.brief_description: GoldenEye 007 inspired endless fun when it was released on the Nintendo 64 – just as long as you didn’t look at anyone’s screen or play as Odd Job. One of the first multi-player first-person-shooters for console, GoldenEye made everyone 007.

constellations_other.name: Gunslingers, good fellas and flea bags
constellations_other.description: Explore how a 1903 western changed the course of filmmaking and videogames by breaking the fourth wall.

constellations_other.name: Capturing first-person POV
constellations_other.description: A comparison of how videogames and feature films have used first person POV shots and sequences and how (for the latter) camera technology has impacted on this.

recommendations.quote: There's never been a better adaptation of film into a videogame than Golden Eye. For the first time, up to four players could shoot it out on one TV screen and take control of one of some of cinema's best heroes and villains. And yes, Odd Job is cheating.

results.description: GoldenEye 007 inspired endless fun when it was released on the Nintendo 64 – just as long as you didn’t look at anyone’s screen or play as Odd Job. One of the first multi-player first-person-shooters for console, GoldenEye made everyone 007.

results.title: Golden Transvaal
results.creator_credit: South African Tourist Corporation and John Da Silva
results.brief_description: Within the borders of the Transvaal is to be found a wide diversity of attractions, both natural and manmade. These include Johannesburg, historic Pretoria, the flat plains and mountain ranges and the warm sub-tropical Lowveld, and the Kruger National Park.

results.title: Golden sands
results.creator_credit: Australian Commonwealth Film Unit, John Martin-Jones and John Shaw
results.brief_description: Describes beach mining for minerals - rutile, zircon, ilmenite and monazite - as an important Australian industry. Shows several methods of extracting these minerals and explains many of their uses.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Australian Commonwealth Film Unit, John Martin-Jones and John Shaw

results.title: Golden river
results.creator_credit: Documentary Films of India and P.V. Pathy
results.brief_description: Rising in the ranges of Coorg, the Kaveri River flows eastwards for nearly 500 miles before entering the Bay of Bengal, traversing ancient agricultural lands, rich in rice and coffee. Traces the course of the Kaveri River which has been considered sacred by the Hindus for centuries. The waters of the river have been utilised for the generation of electic power at Sivasamudram and harnessed in Mysore and Mettur for the two great dams which irrigate thousands of acres of land.

results.title: Golden queen
results.creator_credit: Malayan Film Unit and Zain Hussain
results.brief_description: The pineapple industry in Malaya; harvesting, canning and selling the crop; the organisation of the industry; clearing land for new plantations, planting and caring for the plants; life on the plantation village.

results.title: Golden oldies
results.creator_credit: New Zealand National Film Unit, Derek Wright and Arthur Everard
results.brief_description: There are 80-year-olds who still jog, play golf, paint the roof of their house, work their farms and generally enjoy the hustle and bustle of everyday life. A positive look at ‘old age’ in the golden time of life.
results.creator_credit_for_label: New Zealand National Film Unit, Derek Wright and Arthur Everard
